page.title: 08Language
page.content: Welsh and English is spoken in Alltwen. Many of the original inhabitants are bilingual. Recent housing developments have brought an influx of English and Anglo-Welsh. Although there is still a strong Welsh tradition, the majority of the younger generation speak only English. Only 6 of the 230 pupils in Alltwen Primary School speak Welsh. (Most of the Welsh speaking children attend Welsh schools. In 1926 92% of the children spoke Welsh - many of them monoglot. The Welsh spoken here is peculiar to the area eg. Dywedodd (he said) is pronounced - 'wetws'- the ending 'ws' still in usage from early Welsh. The consonants are hardened - 't' instead of 'd' and the first syllable dropped. The English spoken has adopted a Welsh flavour eg. the Nant (River), the Coed (Trees).
